reviews.text: I came home from Manchester this evening to be confronted with 20 or so youths causing trouble at the station, apparently it's a regular occurrence and there are no security staff there, disgusting, however I'm rating this 5 star due to the young man working there who came out and confronted them all, I don't know his name but he should be promoted for his loyalty and bravery to his job
Useless staff, station is a mess, one ticket machine and nobody working the window during peak times. I dont what this station is playing at but they're completely useless

Scarborough railway station is the end of the line for Trans Pennine Express trains from Liverpool Lime Street station. Other more local trains also use this station. On platform 3 toilets are available including one for disabled passengers and there are also baby changing facilities. The station has a cafe, ticket office and ticket machines.

The train we had tickets for was cancelled and a later one would have meant missing our next two connections.  The lady behind the desk was very helpful and arranged a taxi for us. This took us to Malton where we could get the train.  I think it had been cancelled at Scarborough due to trespassers on the line. The taxi driver was helpful too. We were then able to continue our journey to Leeds , Retford and then Worksop as planned

All disabled spaces outside front of station FULL at 9pm tonight with NOT ONE DISABLED BLUE BADGE..
main carpark has 3disabled bays and 2 are full of big red wheelie bins.  
Station is an ABSOLUTE JOKE.  As disabled person with poor mobility. I had to struggle from a bus stop.It seems TAXIS get PRIORITY and ANYBODY can park in disabled bay ALL DAY ANY DAY without blue badge and get away with it. Plus.station carpark is suposed to be for station users. NOT STEPHEN JOSEPH THEATRE CUSTOMERS. 
DISGRACEFUL. yet TYPICAL of Scarborough
